1/* $NetBSD: getaddresses.c,v 1.3 2019/01/09 16:55:11 christos Exp $ */

14/*! \file */
15
16#include <config.h>
17
18#include <inttypes.h>
19#include <stdbool.h>
20#include <string.h>
21
22#include <isc/net.h>
23#include <isc/netaddr.h>
24#include <isc/netdb.h>
25#include <isc/netscope.h>
26#include <isc/result.h>
27#include <isc/sockaddr.h>
28#include <isc/string.h>
29#include <isc/util.h>
30
31#include <bind9/getaddresses.h>
32
33isc_result_t
34bind9_getaddresses(const char *hostname, in_port_t port,
35 isc_sockaddr_t *addrs, int addrsize, int *addrcount)
36{
37 struct in_addr in4;
38 struct in6_addr in6;
39 bool have_ipv4, have_ipv6;
40 int i;
41
42 struct addrinfo *ai = NULL, *tmpai, hints;
43 int result;
44
45 REQUIRE(hostname != NULL);
46 REQUIRE(addrs != NULL);
47 REQUIRE(addrcount != NULL);
48 REQUIRE(addrsize > 0);
49
50 have_ipv4 = (isc_net_probeipv4() == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
51 have_ipv6 = (isc_net_probeipv6() == ISC_R_SUCCESS);
52
53 /*
54 * Try IPv4, then IPv6. In order to handle the extended format
55 * for IPv6 scoped addresses (address%scope_ID), we'll use a local
56 * working buffer of 128 bytes. The length is an ad-hoc value, but
57 * should be enough for this purpose; the buffer can contain a string
58 * of at least 80 bytes for scope_ID in addition to any IPv6 numeric
59 * addresses (up to 46 bytes), the delimiter character and the
60 * terminating NULL character.
61 */
62 if (inet_pton(AF_INET, hostname, &in4) == 1) {
63 if (have_ipv4)
64 isc_sockaddr_fromin(&addrs[0], &in4, port);
65 else
66 isc_sockaddr_v6fromin(&addrs[0], &in4, port);
67 *addrcount = 1;
68 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
69 } else if (strlen(hostname) <= 127U) {
70 char tmpbuf[128], *d;
71 uint32_t zone = 0;
72
73 strlcpy(tmpbuf, hostname, sizeof(tmpbuf));
74 d = strchr(tmpbuf, '%');
75 if (d != NULL)
76 *d = '\0';
77
78 if (inet_pton(AF_INET6, tmpbuf, &in6) == 1) {
79 isc_netaddr_t na;
80
81 if (!have_ipv6)
82 return (ISC_R_FAMILYNOSUPPORT);
83
84 if (d != NULL) {
85 isc_result_t iresult;
86
87 iresult = isc_netscope_pton(AF_INET6, d + 1,
88 &in6, &zone);
89
90 if (iresult != ISC_R_SUCCESS)
91 return (iresult);
92 }
93
94 isc_netaddr_fromin6(&na, &in6);
95 isc_netaddr_setzone(&na, zone);
96 isc_sockaddr_fromnetaddr(&addrs[0],
97 (const isc_netaddr_t *)&na,
98 port);
99
100 *addrcount = 1;
101 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
102 }
103 }
104 memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(hints));
105 if (!have_ipv6)
106 hints.ai_family = PF_INET;
107 else if (!have_ipv4)
108 hints.ai_family = PF_INET6;
109 else {
110 hints.ai_family = PF_UNSPEC;
111#ifdef AI_ADDRCONFIG
112 hints.ai_flags = AI_ADDRCONFIG;
113#endif
114 }
115 hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
116#ifdef AI_ADDRCONFIG
117 again:
118#endif
119 result = getaddrinfo(hostname, NULL, &hints, &ai);
120 switch (result) {
121 case 0:
122 break;
123 case EAI_NONAME:
124#if defined(EAI_NODATA) && (EAI_NODATA != EAI_NONAME)
125 case EAI_NODATA:
126#endif
127 return (ISC_R_NOTFOUND);
128#ifdef AI_ADDRCONFIG
129 case EAI_BADFLAGS:
130 if ((hints.ai_flags & AI_ADDRCONFIG) != 0) {
131 hints.ai_flags &= ~AI_ADDRCONFIG;
132 goto again;
133 }
134#endif
135 /* FALLTHROUGH */
136 default:
137 return (ISC_R_FAILURE);
138 }
139 for (tmpai = ai, i = 0;
140 tmpai != NULL && i < addrsize;
141 tmpai = tmpai->ai_next)
142 {
143 if (tmpai->ai_family != AF_INET &&
144 tmpai->ai_family != AF_INET6)
145 continue;
146 if (tmpai->ai_family == AF_INET) {
147 struct sockaddr_in *sin;
148 sin = (struct sockaddr_in *)tmpai->ai_addr;
149 isc_sockaddr_fromin(&addrs[i], &sin->sin_addr, port);
150 } else {
151 struct sockaddr_in6 *sin6;
152 sin6 = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)tmpai->ai_addr;
153 isc_sockaddr_fromin6(&addrs[i], &sin6->sin6_addr,
154 port);
155 }
156 i++;
157
158 }
159 freeaddrinfo(ai);
160 *addrcount = i;
161 if (*addrcount == 0)
162 return (ISC_R_NOTFOUND);
163 else
164 return (ISC_R_SUCCESS);
165}
166
